mdRecord.dcterms:title: Hypodermic syringe set and morphine/atrophine vial
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Francis Arnold and Son
Parke, Davis & Company
mdRecord.dcterms:description: The set was owned by Dr. James E. Copeland who practiced in Rectortown, Virginia from 1880 to 1887. Contained in leather box, label on outside: Dr. J.E Copeland, Rectortown Virginia; label on inside: F. Arnold & Son, No 15, Sharp St, Baltimore MD; 1 syringe, [graded 0-25]; 2 brass tips; empty corked glass vial, label information: Hypodermatic Tablets, No. 16, Morphine and Atropine, Rx "H", Parke, Davis & Co.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Medical instruments and apparatus
mdRecord.dcterms:isPartOf: University of Virginia Medical Artifacts Collection
